page.title: 08A Milk Tanker Driver's Day.
page.content: Buzz, buzz, it's 6.30 in the morning and there goes the alarm, it's time to get up. I have a coffee and take my wife Wendy and my son Adam one and off I go to work at the Milk Marketing Board, Brereton. After checking my lorry over and looking at the notice board to see if any farms need to be sampled (every farm tank is sampled at least once a week), off I go on my job, which is called Bulk Milk Collection Driver. This means calling on farms which produce milk and sucking the milk from their tanks into my tanker which holds over two thousand gallons, and takes a few farms to fill it. After leaving the Depot, I pick up at ten farms and after nine more my tanker is loaded. After unloading at the dairy I pick up another load and return to Ashby to unload. Then it is home to the depot to get ready for another day.
